All the staff of villa sumbing and yanti and christophe
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
My wife and I spent 5 nights at the lovely peaceful Villa Sumbing Indah. The place was so cozy surrounded by paddy fields with great view of Mt. Merapi and Mt Sumbing. The owner Yanti and all the staffs  treated us as special guest. My wife were so spoilt by their kindness hospitality and services by addressing her as 'IBU'. getting everything she need. And not to be forgotten the food was outstanding. I would recommend to all traveller who love to get away from the hustle and bustle of their hectic daily life this will be the convenient oasis surrounding by mountains. 
Stayed 13- 18 April  2015 couple from Singapore
title: Wonderful quite and peaceful escape

text:
We booked a 3 night stay at Villa Sumbing and really had a great time. The staff is the kindest you can imagine and we found it very nice to be outside the city although close enough from Borobudur. The surroundings are very nice, the villages around are intact and people everywhere are amazingly friendly, smiling and welcoming.
The rooms are spacious, offer each a nice terrace and are comfortable.
The restaurant offers the typical Indonesian food although a lot of the menu is of French inspiration - a pity for us as it felt a bit too much like home. We of course only had the Indonesian food and it was extremely tasty and well prepared.
We used the services of a driver (Dareh) who was very nice, spoke good English and told us a lot about the culture, the country, etc. This was a very useful way to visit.
title: Great hotel, great service - a good location to relax

text: From the time we arrived Christophe and Yanti spoilt us. The accommodation was exceptional and the staff were so helpful and polite. Transport was arranged for all tours we wanted to do and the drivers were knowledgeable. Christophe even woke me at 4.30am and personally took me to see the sun rise over the Merapi volcano. The scenery from the villa was awesome and the walks around there gave an insight into the local lives. It was relaxing and even the chanting gave an atmosphere. The food was great, especially Christophe's steaks. These lovely people have created something very special.
title: Perfect

text:
We had a wonderful stay at the Villa Sumbing Indah in January 2015. The setting is remote, but absolutely breathtaking. The owners are incredibly gracious and make sure that their guests have everything you need. On our first day, we had tickets to go to Borobudur at sunrise, and the villa coordinated our 3am transportation for us. The restaurant has delicious food (with the freshest mangoes I've ever tasted!). The hikes through the rice paddies and the local area are to die for, and the villa will coordinate local guides who are very knowledgeable about the plants and the area. 

Even though the rooms are not air conditioned, the mountain air kept everything cool. Overall it was a wonderful stay, and I highly recommend!
title: Perfect escape

text: We chose Villa Sumbing as it was close to the Borobudur temple complex and had excellent reviews. It was certainly much more than our family expected. It is small, basic with the most beautiful surreal location, being situated amongst the mountains and paddy fields. We used the large swimming pool at our doorsteps only once, as there was so much to experience during our 5 day stay. The rooms are simple, with no fridge or airconditioning. Being in the midst of nature, one expects a certain amount of wildlife! However, the insect screens, repellant vapours and netting, seem to be fairly effective. We quickly adjusted & even came to appreciate the melodious prayer calls at 4.30am. They add to the  other-world quality of this place! The complimentary breakfasts were my favourite meal, especially the bread, with homemade papaya & mango preserve made by Yanti, one of the owners. Realising my fondness for her jams, she generously gave me a large bottle of her papaya jam on our departure! With the help of the friendly, attentive staff and owners, we had 2 energetic hikes through the village and paddy fields, were driven to the Borobudur and Prambanan temple complexes, visited the active Mount Merapi (the museum,as it was raining that day) and saw an amazing ballet performance of the Ramayana. Villa Sumbing is not very near any of these places, however, the drivers are good and friendly, and the fares reasonable. Our party consisted of 2 teenagers, 3 young adults, my husband & I. For once, everyone had a marvellous time with absolutely no complaints (which those of you with a large family will realise, is jolly miraculous)!
title: Total holiday experience

text: It was a breathtaking experience to wake up with 3 majestic mountains - Mount Sumbing from the back and Mounts Merbabu and Merapi in front of our room. It was also a perfect location for capturing the sunrise. Echoing the rest of the reviews, yes, it was a gem of a place with very lovely hosts who made you feel like they are your old friends coming for a visit :) The western food to us was good - one of the best chicken pizza we've had, grilled caramalised banana dessert was heavenly and breakfast was a simple affair but tasty!  Oh we were served drinks each time we came 'home' from an outing :)
title: perfect hideaway from the maddening crowd..

photos.caption: simple breakfast affair but good and nutritious
a clear view of mount sumbing from the back window
With our lovely hosts, Christophe and Yanti

text: This is a really simple little hotel. Basic and clean. Nestled in the country side with a fantastic view and a pool. Although a little out of the way, transport is provided by the hotel at very reaosnable prices. The massages were also a real bargain and there is nothing more convenient than having a massage in your own room! The food was average. Most importantly, the owner, his wife and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We would certainly visit again if we are in the area.
title: Rustic Simplicity

text:
I found this gem on Trip Advisor and made a late booking when I found myself on my own in Jakarta and decided that it was a good opportunity to travel and Borobudhur was on the top of my bucket list.  The owner, Christof, had been extremely responsive to several questions I had asked in emails, had arranged a car and driver, Pak Dadhe, for me for the 2 days and also provided suggestions for my itinerary.  When I arrived in Yokyakarta, Pak Dadhe picked me up on time and was a brilliant driver for the 2 days.  I toured Pramabanan, then Mount Merapi before going to the hotel where I had a sumptous dinner in their French restaurant.  The hotel was rustic, charming and in a beautiful location.

The next day Christof awoke me personally at 3am for a sunrise tour of Borobudhur (after I had slept through my alarm) which he had also organised for me.  When I returned from this, he drove me to a local village with a guide who he had organised, and we hiked for 2 hours through the beautiful landscape.  He then even helped organise the logistics for my next destination, Mount Bromo, including accomodation, transfers and tour, all of which were much better value than anything that I had found previously.

All in all an unforgettable experience which I largely attribute to Christof (thank you!).  I highly recommend this hotel.
title: More than just a hotel

text:
A spectacular location, great pool, very comfortable accommodation and the food (Indonesian) was really good (at least, it was good for us). The people at this small hotel really made us very welcome. Its about 90 minutes from Yogya (depending on traffic), and about 40 minutes from Borobudur.

As others have said, there are some good walks around the rice fields, and the locals are very very friendly. There is a small local market nearby.

We arranged a car through the hotel to go over to Borobudur twice..we struck traffic the first time, and it took an hour, the next day about 40 minutes.The hotel arranged to meet us at Yogya and arranged a cab to take us back.

The only downside (and its a small one), is that there are a few mosques nearby, and the call to prayer at 4.30 am was really loud! I usually like the muezzin in the early morning, but, it sounded like one was in the room with us! 

We stayed there with our 9 year old son, and the hotel folks were fabulous with him.
title: Great place!

text:
Great rural location with a view of the paddy fields. Some nice walks can be done around the village. A walk up the road will take you to a large village market - all kinds of birds, food and clothes for sale.
Villas are spacious and the decor is very authentic. Pool is large for a villa property. The swing and cabana are a nice touch.

Quite a distance from the city - makes for limited choices of food. In-house restaurant food is okay - nothing great. We are vegetarian - may be the other food was good. Scrambled eggs had too much salt and the Indonesian food also didn't stand out. We also had the pizza a couple of times - again very ordinary. 

Christophe and yanti are friendly people. Ditto for the staff. Did try to be of assistance without being intrusive.
title: Overall good. Great location. Food is a small issue.

text: First let me say most of the reviews here are accurate. This jewel of a place is away from most everything. I travel Indonesia a lot and usually stay in larger cities but from here on when working in tis area this will be my first choice. Although no air conditioner with the fan the nights are fine. The restaurant has a wide selection and. I found the food to be very good. The breakfast in the morning was excellent and more than I needed. This hotel being in a rural area of course you may see a few bogs but nothing major. I do have to say my first night maybe a few too many but went down got spray and ended that. The next night no issues. The hotel owners were very apologetic about this and was willing to move my room but it was only a minor inconvenience and was remedied quickly. Being I was working did not get to do the rice field tour but hopefully next time. In conclusion if you want a really neat place to stay with great people, good food, peace and quite, book this. Also Borobudur worth the visit.
title: AWAY FROM EVERYTHING

text:
We were completely bowled over by how lovely this place is, for the price, we hadn't expected something so good.( We had only booked for 2 nights )
Our room was large with an adjoining sitting area and a large bathroom.
Everything was very clean, the bed comfortable, the shower hot.
There were no fly screens and no a/c but we didn't need either in mid June ( no bugs and the weather perfect ) there was a fan, and the bed had mosquito nets which we didn't use.
Our sitting room even had a little bar area with a system dispensing cooled water and hot water for coffee/ tea ( sachets provided ).
All the rooms had a little front verandah with table and chairs over looking the sparkling pool.
The  French/ Indonesian  restaurant provide a very good breakfast ( included ) and good quality and variety of meals for lunch and dinner.
The countryside surrounding this villa is gorgeous and the hotel can arrange good walks around the hills and amongst the rice terraces .
One morning we looked over the hedge alongside the pool to see a water buffalo and handler ploughing the small field next to the villa.
The staff here is first class and friendly, the owners Chris ( French ) and Shanti ( Indonesian ) work had to keep standards high but still give it that family owned friendly feel.
We're hoping to go back one day, enjoyed our stay so much.
title: Wow, this place has it all.

photos.caption: where we walked on our way to a temple
ploughing the rice field next to the villa

text:
We stayed at Villa Sumbing Indah for 3 nights. We chose to stay here as it was close to Borobudur and less expensive than other hotels in the area which were listed on Tripadvisor. Our room was the VIP villa for two which came with a living room and dining area, with lovely teak wood furniture. There is no air-conditioning in the rooms but it was cool indoors and we had no trouble sleeping at night. As the room is next to the fields, you will see the occassional frog, lizard and insects in the room but it didn't bother us too much. The swimming pool is right next to the rooms and very close to nature, which makes for a nice swim.

Yanti and her staff were helpful in arranging for transport from the airport and tours to Borobudur and Prambanan. However, the drivers don't speak English so it is best to let Yanti or the English-speaking staff know your requirements and preferences and ask them to communicate this to the drivers.

All in all, it was a comfortable and relaxing stay for us.
title: Cosy villa surrounded by rice fields

text:
I spent a weekend in Jogjakarta and Borobudur May 11 and 12 and stayed overnight at the Villa Sumbing. Yanti and Christophe were extremely friendly in all regards. Helping us to arrange travel to pick us up a the airport, giving us indications to walk in the rice fields (1.5 hours hike we wanted to do) as well getting us a driver to show the temples to us in Borobudur and Jogjakarta. They left nothing to be desired. 
And not to be forgotten the food was outstanding and the service very friendly. I can only recommend this for any travellers. There is a lot of value for money and on the food a lot of value full stop. So if you don't want to spend the 450 usd on the number 1 hotel this is the place to be !
title: Had a great dad and son weekend

text: Yanti and Christoph have created a lovely little place in the hills. Their attention to the guests is great, the rooms, views and food are beautiful and the walks around the surrounding villages and rice fields are stunning!
title: Lovely setting and dito hosts

text:
Usually when you travel around SE Asia, the bathrooms are a bit of a disappointment even when it is a pretty nice place. But here, the bathroom is great.  The place made me happy to come back to the hotel after a long sight seeing. Christophe and Yanti are very accommodating and loving. We had a vegetarian friend and they cooked specially for him. And of course made us a great Indonesian dinner for us to enjoy the local taste. 
 
The place is designed for all the rooms have the pool right in front of their door. And when you look out towards the pool sitting on the porch, you see a gorgeous village with rice fields and houses. The view is extraordinary. 

And the sound of the prayers that you can hear adds another charm to the place. It is peaceful experience. 

I will definitely go back.
title: peaceful place with a great view

text: It is difficult to describe such a sublime experience. The afternoon we arrived the golden sun was setting over the terraced rice fields painting them electric green. It's as if the entire place has been put under a magical spell. Yanti and Christophe could not be more genial and helpful, Their enthusiastic nature and love of their land is infectious. We enlisted them in our decision making about what to see and their recommendations always led to excellent and beautiful adventures. And everyday when we returned from days chock filled with walking, the beautiful pool and a fresh glass of guava or soursop juice was immediately served to us. Sleep here was divine. Lulled into dreams buy the cool, fresh mountain air and the lulling sound of the call to prayer, a sound that more than once, put me into a trance. The place vibrates with mystical energy. I was very sad to leave and will CERTAINLY return!
title: AMAZING!

text:
Christophe and Yanti's place will be for sure one of our best memories in our Indonesian trip.
Charming place, in the middle of terrasse ricefields, with no tourists around, with so kind staff coming from the village next door. The fact that there is only 5 rooms makes Christophe and Yanti's place really intimate. We advise you the big room which is like a "honey moon suite" in a sophisticated Indenosian style. You wake up in the morning in the middle of rice fields and have the choice to visit Borobudur or to make one of Christophe local excursions into the villages surrounding with superb landscape and really kind local guides. When you come back, the superb swiming pool is waiting for you before eating the best of french cuisine! Christophe and Yanti are so warm that they will make you want to stay longer than expected. In 3 words: a little paradise...

Sophie and Jack
title: Little paradise in an peaceful and extraordinary place!

text: The least we can say is that we spent five lovelly days at Villa Sumbing. The owner and his wife looked after us as if we were close friends. The hotel is perfectly located to visit the main sites around Yogya. Comfortable rooms, nice swimming-pool and high-quality restaurant. Calm and serenity bang in the middle of a rice-paddie, with view over the Merapi. I recommend it without any hesitation.
title: The place to stay around Jogya

text:
A great place owned by great people. The rooms are clean, food is great and the surroundings are wonderful. The owners really know how to take care their customers, and will offer you any help to enjoy your stay. Ask for the 2-3 hours walk in the surrounding padi fields, it's wonderful.
The best address in Indonesia so far for me.
title: The perfect place around borobudur

text: Very nice stay with our 10 years old kid , we chilled around the pool and discovered the surroundings. Nice fresh air from the mountain. We also loved the home made food : grilled sausages, dry sausages, French pot au feu and many more.
title: Chilling by the pool and walking in the surrounding villages

text: My husband and I stayed with our 2 year old toddler at the Villa Sumbing Indah from 5 to 15 August 2020. We stayed in a chaming joglo wooden cottage which is fully equipped with a kitchen, dining area, and TV corner. The whole place is surrounded by lush paddy fields, with magnificent views on Gunung Sumbing and Gunung Merapi. The restaurant serves French food, and a very good and generous breakfast (fried rice, eggs, croissants, home-made mango and papaya jam, fresh juice, etc.). For those who wish to enjoy the green environement, you can step out of the hotel, cross the road and go for a long walk through quiet and beautiful paddy fields. Coming from Jakarta, we really enjoyed that!! Finally what made our stay at the Villa Sumbing Indah most memorable is the staff of the hotel. Ibu Yanti, Pak Christophe and their team are extremely nice, warm and helpful! They love playing with children, so it is a GREAT place to come with children!
title: Charming hosts in a charming place!

text: We decided this  visit to Borobodur last minute and had one of more relaxing weekend of the year. We lodge in the small bungalow open to a small garden in the middle of rice fields. The host Yanti and Christophe are extremely welcoming and gave us , organising our pick up, giving us  very good advice on what to do.  We visited  Borobodur temple on Saturday and on Sunday we did an amazing trek close to the property, crossing rice fields, waterfall, small village with local market.  We then went to Yogakarta before heading back to Singapore. We will come back . Sumbing Villa will become soon one of our best place to go for a green relaxing weekend.
title: Hidden gem close to Borobudur temple

text:
The most perfect and lovely place fir the region, you have everything around, countryside, volcanos, near Yogyakarta, we stayed there with my friends during long weekend, we had a really really good time especially after a long climbing day for mount sumbing, had had delicioys french diner at the villa simbung!
Thanks Christophe and Yanti
title: perfect

text: Villa Sumbing Indah is a little piece of paradise.  A sublimely beautiful location amid the luscious green rice fields of Magelang, Central Java.  Very friendly and helpful owners and staff.  Amazing French restaurant benefiting from co-owner Christophe's French heritage.  Peaceful and tranquil.  Excellent breakfast included.  Lots of attention to detail.  My only issue was that the rooms are a little warm in the evenings although an electric fan is provided.  Overall excellent and I will definitely want to return.
title: A Piece of Paradise

text: The owners and staff were welcoming and helpful. The driver we booked through the hotel was a safe, skillful driver. The location is peaceful, the rooms are clean and spacious, and the pool and garden are relaxing. It was easy to arrange day trips to Borobudur and walks through nearby rice paddies. The property is in the middle of scenic rice paddies. Unfortunately, that means critters, which we heard in the roof at night.
title: Peaceful location

text: I had a really lovely stay here. The staff are some of the kindest people, and they were so friendly and helpful. It was wonderful that they had an airport pick-up option, and the location is very near Borobudur - they helped arrange a sunrise viewing and visit to the amazing temple. The rooms are nice and the pool is lovely. They also made delicious food and drinks.
title: Lovely stay

text:
Very nice place to visit central java and very nice staff. 

The room was great and the landscape on the volcano was amazing. The staff was very kind and very helpful. 

Thank you Yanti and Christophe for their advices. Many excursions for good price to see volanos, temples...
title: Very nice place

owner_response.text: We are very happy to have stink to receive you has VILLA SUMBING INDAH, we thank you, in name of all the team to have come visit us. We shall keep a good memory of your passage and hope to be able to receive you has new during a next stay. All the staff of villa sumbing indah yanti and christophe
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
An amazing accommodation in a rather quiet, rural environment, surrounded by the nicest rice fields we saw in Indonesia. Great rooms with large confort and beautiful furnitures. Very friendly owners (French and Javanese) who helped well to organize our stay in an amazing manner and covered us with many lovely attentions.

Great food for breakfast, continental, with amazing fruits (the best we had in Indonesia). Nice restaurant inside the hotel with very keen and lovely staff ; some of them trying hard and well to speak French in addition to English. Prices are so reasonable as compared to Singapore. But like everywhere in Indonesia, alcohols are expensive outside beer. The lunch/dinner menu is huge, a lot French oriented but with magnificent fusion (French-Indonesian) recipes (their chicken curry sounds inspired from French blanquette but with an Indonesian signature). Their foie gras, paté, escargots (from Sumatra but with a French way to prepare it with local Javanese leeks !), French sausage are just amazing. Local French-type cheeses also made. The menu is just incredible given the variety of products offered. The owners says they are not professionals but they do often way better than many professionals ! They could even prepare us an extra Indonesian menu with fresh (I say again : fresh) frogs legs that were not in the menu as well as a huge gourami fish prepared following local recipes. This was simply the best frog legs ever in my life.

The pool is great, the best we had in Indonesia. 
Gardens are beautiful and a great place for resting in between 2 trips around.
Luckily we got only a few mosquitos.
Rice fields right below our windows.

Well organized trips available at the hotel. We asked them to organize a trip with a driver to less touristy places you would have picked yourself or got recommandations from the owners. We saw a great waterfall (although small) but in a very nice environment (despite not that clean, local farmers are not keen on trash…).  But got descriptions of many plants like cloves (fresh green cloves is amazing !), pepper, lemongrass (and many more) that grow everywhere naturally. Amazing, just amazing hinduist temples visited despite in the middle of a muslim island. Very safe and careful drivers. Some of them also keen with French !

The only « problems » are not related to the hotel but Java island : heavy traffic due to the people density of that island, the highest in the world. Long ride from/to the airport through suburbs that look much poorer as compared to Bali. Also, muezzins « sing » 4 times a day (sunrise, noon, end afternoon and sunset). Be prepared to hear them for a good hour (in Egypt the same prayers last only a few minutes). But after 2 days, we did not hear them anymore and did not pay attention anymore.
title: parfait, recommandé !

text:
I was in Villa 4. Was welcomed with fruit basket and drink. Bed has mosquito net above but also the windows have nets available. Nice porch right towards pool with cushioned chairs. Living room wooden bench only (always sat outside anyway). No closed bedroom (which didn't disturb me). 
Nice pool with 1,95 depth one end and other half more shallow. Awesome view to the volcano and also Gunung Sumbing and others around.
Food in the Restaurant was good. My favorite the mango and papaya jam for breakfast.
Christophe and Yanti are very nice and helpful and all staff was very polite and friendly. (also flexible with breakfast times or taxi service in the early morning).

I liked the location. Close to lush green rice paddies. Not as noisy as in town but obviously farther away from some "tourist" stuff. 
Noisy as well in mornings and evenings at prayer times.

Should check out the stars from the pool chair (when not cloudy!)
title: Relaxation under the Milky Way and with sunrise view or the volcanoes

owner_response.text: We are very happy to have stink to receive you has VILLA SUMBING INDAH, we thank you, in name of all the team to have come visit us. We shall keep a good memory of your passage and hope to be able to receive you has new during a next stay. All the staff of villa sumbing indah yanti and christophe
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Unfriendly Staff, poor FO service  and racist towards local visitors
they providing us with additional cost that unexpected and unreasonable
they say "Local people (indonesian) who stay here just annoy the foreigners who live here"
Unstable hot water and we found centipedes in the pool
title: I don't recommend that for your to stay here

text:
The premises are really private with a great view of the rural area and Mt Merapi and Mt Sumbing. Truly picturesque. We did a walk around the village and the people were extremely friendly and helped us out when we lost the way.

Truly rustic living away from the city and you just simply slow down and unwind to the great landscape. I felt very relaxed for once after a long, long time - I just slowed down. It also allowed us to bond as family.

The owners are simply terrific. They even got us breakfast to go when they were aware we were leaving early for a tour of Borobudur. And complimentary juices coming flowing in the afternoon. Great hospitality.

There is an old temple in the vicinity that you must visit. Its a drive into the village and ride up on a bike...the view is simply breathtaking. Just ask the owners when you visit; best experienced than shared here.
title: Rustic living away from the hustle and bustle of the city

text:
Located on a small country road in the midst of rice fields, Sumbing Indah is perfect for those seeking solitude, comfort and local culture.  We were here for three days and wished we had booked for a few more days.  The accommodation was perfect. The food was good.  Nice pool. Great local walks through the rice fields. The day trip to Borobudur was organised for us with an excellent guide, as was a day trip to the Hindu temples at Candi Gedong Songo. The staff are delightful. 
The only drawback was the 0430 wake-up calls from the surrounding mosques - but then, when in an Islamic country, you just have to live with this . . . . 
Would definitely stay here again.
title: Great place to and experience rural Java

photos.caption: Gunung Merapi in morning mist - still smoking!

text: If you think Ubud is a great place to relax? maybe it is. But you got to come here to experience the whole lots of Indonesian holistic nature, the volcano, the temples, the rice paddy field, the countryside in one place! This is something Ubud doesn't have. It's in a remote area but whose are holidaying in noisy place? It has French resto with variety of Indonesian menu, and Aussie beef! Prices are not expensive. Definitely will visit the place again and recommend friends if they need somewhere relaxing from their busy life.
title: This is a place when culture, nature, and comfy combined

text:
Comfortable rooms next to the pool and good food (Indonesian or French if you like).
Christophe and his wife can help organise transport (to the Borobudur), visits, outings (very nice 2-3 hours walk through the ricefields with old Hindu temple on top with spectacular views.
But you can also just cross the road and wander through the sawahs there for fantastics pics of the loomng Sumbing volcanoe or two other volcanoes further afield.
A bit more expensive than other accomodation in Indonesia but completely worth it. Value for money. We were 9, so book in advance, but other just booked the day before.
title: Comfort and surroundings

text: We spent 4 nights recently at Villa Sumbing. The room was spacious and the pool 2 steps away. A welcome drink when we arrived back each day was a pleasant touch. Christophe and his wife were very helpful and arranged onward train tickets for us. A high spot was the 3 hour trek he arranged for us through the local rice fields with one of his staff. I would recommend as a convenient oasis for Borobadur.
title: A great spot to spend a few days

text:
We only spent a night here, having arrived late in the evening and having left early in the morning to catch the Borobudur sunrise.

The Good:

The food at the restaurant was reasonably priced and delicious, which was a relief after our long journey, given that this place is tucked away in a fairly remote area and doesn't have any other good food alternatives around.

The rooms were clean and spacious with good wi-fi connectivity.

The entire setting of this place was cozy, the staff was warm and friendly and accommodating of our various requests.

The owner/manager was friendly and helpful, and personally tried to ensure our stay was comfortable.

The Not-so-good:

Mosquitoes abound in this area, and in spite of the mosquito nets over the beds, they can be quite pesky when you sleep.

The rooms were not quiet at all - we could hear the noisy chatter of a group of women in the room next to ours, over and above the drone of their television set, late into the night.

The location is quite remote and tucked away in the hillside, so you need to ensure your taxi driver knows exactly where this place is, or else you should be equipped with at least a map, a mobile phone and contact number of the managers here so that they can guide the taxi driver to the right place.

Overall, we had a decent stay, but I doubt I could have lasted more than a night here because of the mosquitoes and the noisy rooms.
title: Cozy, clean, cottage-like-place!

owner_response.text:
Why when people leave say to us everything is very well no problem, then on the comment they write the opposite.
To speak to us problem directly and as possible shall solve them
thanks for your commentare
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
My wife and I spent two nights at the lovely, peaceful Villa Sumbing Indah hotel located in Kalegen, about 20 minutes’ drive up the slope of the Sumbing volcano west and north of Magelang, Central Java, Indonesia.  This hotel has five lovely rooms along side a sparkling clean swimming pool surrounded on three sides by rice paddies and with a lovely view over the Magelang valley.  The hotel is about 45 minutes from Borobudur, an hour a fifteen minutes from Yogyakarta and a couple of hours from Prambanan.  It thus provides reasonable access to these points of interest and also to the Dieng Plateau region.  The delightful owner, Rubiyanti Lavaud, who runs the hotel’s day-to-day activities along with her French-born husband, is happy to arrange for transportation to any / all of these attractions as well as pick-up / drop-off at local airports such as Yogyakarta (two hours) or Semarang (three and a half hours).  The hotel has a very nice restaurant and the cost of the overnight includes an excellent breakfast served at your table.   Our room (the smaller, two-person villa) had an exterior porch by the pool, a living room with couch, TV and bar connecting to the bedroom.  The walls / ceiling are beautifully finished in bamboo and matting.  The bed is furnished with mosquito nets.  The bathroom is comfortable with plenty of hot water.  Everything is scrupulously clean and the décor is lovely. 

This is the place to choose if you are looking for peace, tranquility and natural beauty, and do not require proximity to a city center or a large hotel with many amenties.  Magelang is just 20 minutes away.   Given the traffic snarls, noise and unrestricted development overtaking all the main roads of Central Java, we greatly appreciated the hotel’s location.  We took walks in the morning through Kalegen village and on side roads into the rice fields, enjoying views of the Sumbing volcano and the terraced agriculture.  We watched farmers plowing the fields with buffalo and taking the ducks out for feeding as the sun rose, to a chorus of early morning bird-calls.  The hotel has a small but lovely garden (with fish pond) at one end of the pool.  

We discovered Villa Sumbing Indah through trip advisor (while at another hotel in Salatiga which we wanted to leave) but you can reach Ruby at 62(country code)-81328042721 (for additional numbers see website), villa.sumbing.indah@hotmail.fr or http://villa-sumbing-indah-id.com.
title: Very enjoyable stay at Villa Sumbing Indah

photos.caption: Typical scene in the hotel environs
Sumbing volcano from near the hotel

text:
Lovely setting on the hill above Borobodur town. Great views of Mt Merapi
We had the end room round the corner from the pool, with three separate rooms + bathroom.
The room was clean and comfortable. Wi-fi was good.
Dinner was good though the menu was a bit restricted.
Generally the hotel is very peaceful, though we were woken by chanting in the night from a  mosque.
The owner is very friendly
title: Beautiful setting

text: Our family very much enjoyed our stay in this hotel. The staff kept the room clean, provided food efficiently and sorted our local tours well. Our children found that the hotel is quite close to a very busy road so when we tried to do family walks - the back roads were really gorgeous - the first 10 minutes or so were not very pleasant. That being said, we very much enjoyed being based in the country for our visit to Borobodur.
title: Nice hotel, good food, close to busy road

text: Initially we chose this spot because of its proximity with the Borobudur and the Dieng plateau. Coming from Bali by car, Villa Sumbing Indah was the first place we REALLY enjoyed on Java ; apart from Dr. Harry’s surf camp in Pacitan !! It’s setting is lovely, just outside of Magelang and only a short and nice drive from Borobudur (ask the owner for the itinerary). As it is located on the Sumbing volcano it is also a lot more pleasant in terms of freshness, than in the valleys around or Jogja. (Sleeping without air-co becomes a treat). The couple that run the place are adorable and will try to help you in any way. Nice hikes around the place ; even if they are a little overpriced. Lots of treats on the menu for this part of Java where you quickly get fed up with the very few local dishes. The rooms are lovely and comfortable ; with good beds, window shutters, mosquito nets, water fountain, etc., etc., and unusually well equipped bathrooms for this area, with warm water galore, real shower head and fair pressure on the water. We personally have trouble understanding how people can give this place less than a very good rating… unless this kind of rating only applies to places such as the Waldorf.
title: Breath of fresh air

text:
As many reviews mention, it is very quiet, in the middle of nowhere on the edge of a medium-traffic road. A lovely pool which was immacualtely clean and refreshing after a warm walk around some of the local villages.

We had the suite which we felt was a little overprice when compared to other alternatives but a superb breakfast helped take the edge off the inevitable 4am wakeup (Even if you sleep heavily, bring ear plugs, anywhere in Java has a lot of mosques and it isn't just for five minutes, usually 15-20).

Bathroom was okay, shower had good water pressure but the towels were small and thin. At this price you'd expect a proper good quality towel. The bed has mosquito net (no mosquito's anyway) was fine, no aircon but it is cool enough not to need. The duvet was musty and not newly cleaned though (Although bed sheets underneath were clean and again, not acceptable at this level IMHO).

The potential for some great Franco-Indonesian fusion cuisine was there but it's a relatvely simple menu with French and Indonesian classics but imagine it serves them well given their very remote location. There is not really anywhere else to eat. However the steaks were simply superb and we ate them two night in a row they were so good.

Service was consistently first rate, drivers turned up on time and the local sights were amazing.

It's not the kind of hotel you would stay a week, more a pleasant drop-in for the local sights and then away. Improvements to the rooms, a more varied menu, better bedding and towels and they could justify their current pricing levels. As it is, I think it is a little on the expensive side for many nice Indonesian hotels with a better location. I think the standard rooms represent better value but the suite's additional cost is certainly not justified.
title: Quiet and peaceful but with a little more potential

owner_response.text:
First of all thank you for coming has VILLA SUMBING INDAH to spend about days
We enregister your remarks and to make everything to rectify (although is the first time which we have this remark)
The menu card has more than 40 differents dishes, I am surprised which seems to you not enough variees 
the management
 Yanti and christophe
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
I've been there alone, for two days, I must say that I was surprised by the quality and the situation of this little resort. I was looking for a getaway place, somewhere I just can relax. Villa Sumbing Indha is that place.
Great view on the Sumbing volcano, the paddy fields all around and 10mn drive from Magelang city. The room, the swimming-pool, the restaurant, everything was good. I got an one hour javanese massage from a local lady, a little expensive, but a must do ! The swimming-pool is a real pool, very long and with 1,85m high on its deepest. The room is rustic, all in bamboos, with mosquito net around the bed, love the shower, simple but effective. The food, western or indonesian, à la carte ! 
They are quite easy to find, since the location on Google Map is correct.
I definitely recommend Villa Sumbing Indah.
title: Great place to stay

photos.caption: 2m from the room and you are in the swimming-pool
Paddy fields next to the swimming-pool

text:
Wasn't quite sure what to expect from this place as I chose it purely from the reviews here but was pleasantly surprised. Perfect for a quiet (as in non-city) getaway, the villa is 1.5 hours from Yogyakarta airport to the north, actually going pass Borobudur (which was the main reason for my visit) next to the city of Magelang right between the two major volcanoes. 

It is a small boutique hotel just outside of the town in the rural area so there isn't really anywhere to go within walking distance as it mostly surrounding farmland, which also meant most of the meals were in the hotel which was pretty good. The included breakfast was excellent. The standard rooms are more like a 1 bedroom suite with a separate living and bedroom which was very clean. Has free wi-fi. The rooms don't have air-conditioning (there is a standing fan in the room) so it takes awhile for things to cool down and it got chilly around 3am or so. There are no insect screens on the windows but there is a traditional net to cover the bed. I just kept the windows closed. For the really light sleepers, bring earplugs, the night life (aka insects and animals) can make quite the din if you're not used to it and as previous reviewers have mentioned 4am mosque prayer calls (which didn't really bug me that much). 
Loved the 25m outdoor pool, spent several afternoons lounging around there. The hosts and owners Yanti and Christophe were super friendly and were helpful in recommending places to visit. English is not their first language so be patient (and clear on requests). 

I did the sunrise tour of Borobudur which I highly recommend as the morning light and mist is just fantastic,  it also beats the hordes who start showing up by the time you're done seeing the place. Other must see place include Prambanam.  I also went on a 3 hour farmland walk around which was nice (bring insect repellant). The staff were very friendly and never failed to bring a cold drink each time I came back from one of their trips. Costs were reasonable although the transportation around to the sights were on the higher end. The driver was great in recommending other places to see around the main destination.

Overall, if you're looking for a place away from the hustle and bustle of cities this would be nice.
title: A little rustic getaway

text:
What a relief to get out of Jogyakarta and be in the tranquil countryside!  We chose Villa Sumbing on the recommendation of other travelers and we were really happy!  It is a beautiful small boutique hotel with only a few rooms, set in the lush countryside about a half hour from Borobudur, the largest and most impressive Buddhist temple in Indonesia, and maybe the world!
We arranged a driver from the hotel to meet us at the airport and on the way, we stopped for a half day at Prmbanan, the large Hindu comlex of temples.  Then about 2 hours drive to the hotel.  
We enjoyed relaxing at the pool (it was hot hot hot at the temples!) and had dinner at the hotel.
The rooms are large and spotless, with a perfect view of Mt. Sumbing volcano on one side and the twinking lights of the city in the distance on the other.
The following day, a driver/guide from the hotel took us to Borobadur and we spent most the day there, and then off to Jogjakarta to fly home.  The design of the two days was perfect.  
If you are interested in seeing these two temples, don't try to do it in one day!!  They are large, and very comlex, and especially in the heat, much too much for a day.  At Prambanan you can rent a cheap bicycle to see the outlying temples.

The small downside of the experience:  
The food in the resaurant is average at best.  So, a few mediocer (sp?) meals won't ruin your trip!  
Communicating in English by e mail was difficult but possible.  French would be prefered.  Be sure to have a good understanding of costs, airport pick up etc before you go.  They only accept cash including for the drivers you must hire.

Bring earplugs!  There is a Muslim call to prayer at 4 am, with competing Mosques all chanting on loudspeakers!  With earplugs, no problem but without, you will be up with the faithful!
If you have an extra day to lounge around it would be lovely to do so there.  Very pretty and nice staff.
title: Excellent choice for visiting Borobudur and Prambanan

text:
My wife and I were drawn to this hotel for its country charm, well-rated cuisine, and promise of peace of mind. Only the first of these was fulfilled, as described by others.

The food offerings were far from being French, as the French owner doesn't cook and his local staff know nothing about French cuisine. The meal choices and quality left much to be desired and we were in a captive situation, as there were no other restaurants within miles.  

We stayed in the end suite, immediately adjacent to the wet paddy fields. Our peace of mind was shattered on the second day of our four night stay when we saw slithering in the field just outside our window a snake about one metre (3 feet) long. We later described the snake to our guide who confirmed it was Java's most deadly snake. 

The construction of the hotel windows, rafters and doors provide openings which can easily let slithering reptiles in. We pointed out the inherent risks to Christopher, the hotel owner, who assured us that he will take further serious steps to keep out these dangerous creatures. It's a year now since we visited the hotel and hopefully, for the safety of other guests he has implemented the proper safeguards. Our "Poor" rating reflects the safety risk during our visit. 

The hotel has the potential for greatness but its present owners need to be more professional and concerned about how they run the place.
title: Safety First!

owner_response.text:
it is obvious when were comes in indonesia especially in the countryside, which are going to see snakes.
For the rest, you are giving your personal opinion as fact Each one wants
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: We travelled from Surabaya by train (much better than travelling by road) and were picked up in Yogyakarta by a driver from the villa. We stopped off at Prambanan the Hindu temples on the way to the villa and then relaxed in the pool before dinner that evening. The next day we headed off to see the Borobudur and followed Yanti's recomendation for a restaurant for lunch - which ended up as being one of our best meals in Indonesia. It was wonderfully relaxing, the sort of place you take a book to relax with and even though the restaurant was full on the Saturday night with a live band playing we had our own reserved tables in the courtyard. We were very well looked after and left with the impression that you would have to have spent a lot of money for a better stay in this neck of the woods...
title: A lovely haven

text: The hotel is small and very remote.  The staff is very helpful and the owners bent over backwards to make our stay special.  We were met at the airport as arranged by the hotel and the driver suggested a detour to see an amazing Hindu site (we went to see Borobudur so this was a bonus) then took us to the hotel -- about 1 and a half hours away.  The next day, the same driver took us to Borobudur and to see craft shops as arranged by our host.  We had another excellent experience.  We left the next day quite early, and the owners got up to give us breakfast before leaving for the airport.  Our rooms were large and clean; the site was on a hill with views of the city below us.  We didn't get much chance to enjoy the hotel or use the pool, but we found the overall experience more than met out expectations.
title: Enjoyed our stay here

text:
We spent 3 nights early October at Villa Sumbing, where we had booked a standard room. The driver picked us up at Solo airport, and it took us approx. 3hrs to reach the hotel, that is in the middle of nowhere (but this was our choice). It is a very quiet and very nice place, amidst the rice fields (although, like everywhere in Java, you can be awaken rather early by the call to prayer). The room was large and comfortable, with private bathroom. Very good bedding. No fridge available but a fontein of cold and hot water. Tea & coffee at disposable. A covered terrace with cosy armchairs to relax. All rooms look out on the pool. No airconditioning but since the hotel is a bit in altitude, you don't need it.
We took all our meals at the hotel as there are no other choices in the neighbourhood. But the food is excellent and the menu is varied (Indonesian & French cuisine). Fresh fruit at breakfast but always the same (pineaple, watermelon and papaya). Just like everywhere we went in Java & Bali.
We were the only ones in the hotel (2 couples of friends). The owners were abroad but the staff  were very attentive, charming & helpul. They organize tours on request (rice fields trips, Borobudur, Prambanam, Jogya ...), which is most welcome since you need a car to visit all these places, some rather far away; 600,000 Rs one day trip).
And last but not least: free internet access.
I would recommend this hotel both to couples and family.
title: Indah is beautiful

text:
The setting of this villa is just amazing even though it is quite a drive from Jogjakarta.  A walk around the area allows you to see gorgeous rice paddies, remote villages and an amazing volcano. Highly recommend using their driver even though it is pricey but well worth it.  The staff is ready to make any travel arrangements for you and always had a cold drink ready just when you needed it. 

The villa itself was a little disappointing.  Not the cleanest with many ants and bugs all over the place. The pool was very dirty but my kids still seemed to enjoy it. Having your room right off the pool is also very convenient. We asked for an extra fan as there is no AC and we were charged for it but again totally worth it to get a good nights sleep. The restaurant had amazing food that even my picky son loved. They always had little extras to add to the experience. Wasn't too keen on seeing a mouse running around near the kitchen but I guess that's part of the rustic charm. 

I guess if you're looking for a restful retreat you will find it but if you like super clean and comfy you may want to look elsewhere.  Probably wont go back even though there were many wonderful things about it.
title: Beautiful area but not clean and comfortable.

text:
I stayed here with my mother and we were impressed with the staff and comfort of the rooms. We particularly enjoyed the balcony and peaceful surroundings as well as their excellent menu. The salads were especially good and breakfast is huge. We were treated to some Javanese dance one night and that was great to see after our dinner. They gave us a lot of free treats at every meal and their lumpia are gorgeous! 
We travelled to Borabudur from here and they also arranged transport to Semarang. The ladies behind the desk were helpful and well-informed. I would definitely stay again and recommend this place. 

Our only small gripe might be that the balcony furniture in our villa wasn't very comfortable, but we didn't complain about it and all the other villas had basket chairs with cushions, so perhaps it was just ours. It certainly wasn't enough to make us not love the place and feel like it was good value for money.
title: A real retreat

text: We stayed in the hotel Villa Sumbling Indah in september 2012.   The place was really nice.  The staff is friendly.  The pool was really nice and clean.  The rooms are large and quiet.  The restaurant is french and very good.  We highly recommanded this place.
title: Nice place to stay and relax near Borobudur

text:
The setting and rooms are really fantastic.  The staff are vy sweet and friendly.

I was not so impressed with a couple of other things though...

1) pool was a graveyard of a staggering amount of insects.  I couldn't swim in it even though I really wanted to.  Didn't see anyone else swimming either.

2) the French guy who owns it asked us if we needed a driver to go to  for the sunrise, I asked him how much it was and he told me.  I said we would think about it and get back to him if we were interested.  Having read another review on here saying that they were charging far too much, I was quite conscious of what he was going to quote, so had already neared at another hotel in the town.  Turns out he was charging WAY too much, so we never got back to him.

Early The next morning 2 drivers turn up inc ours and we jumped in to the dismay of the other guy, who we thought must've been for someone else.

Much later with my wife sick and both in us very tired, we returned to the hotel and a very irate proprietor!  He insisted that we had booked the driver and demanded to know why we had gone off with someone else.  We politely tried to explain that we never confirmed we would want a driver, in both English and French (my wife's French), but he was having none of it.  He ended up snarling at us and throwing his hands in the air and walking off.  I was pretty angry to say the least.  Is wife was more charming, but overcharged us for the scooter we had used the day before.  By this stage I couldn't be bothered to argue, despite the fact our guide to take us up to the crater of the volcanoes on the scooters had actually never been up there and we all got completely lost and freezing cold.  Another story... But essentially she was making me pay extra for this service the next day!  We never even saw the volcano as he admitted he'd never been there before!

Just need to temper some of these amazing reviews, as I went there completely on the back of them.  If you are reading this owners, you should LOWER your driver prices and learn about customer service, as otherwise you would have a truly magical establishment to be proud of.  These things count.

P.s. Make sure your driver from Yogyarkata knows exactly where the place is as ours clearly didn't and without my Ipad we'd have been 5 hours instead of just 2.5 when it should only be 1!
title: Disappointed with owner

text: Wonderful location, close enough to Borobodur yet far enough away to avoid the hassle of tourist crowds and all that comes with it. Rooms are large, and with only three/four the place is quiet. Pool is delightful with a good view towards the rice paddies. Ownders Christophe and Yanti were very friendly, met our every need from a 3.30am wake up call to motorbike rental, to preparing a tasty dinner. Heartily recommend and would visit again!
title: Lovely place to stay

text:
We had 3 days at the villa and not only is the setting absolutely stunning but the staff & owners incredibly helpful & the staff go out of their way to help you. Little touches with every meal made this stay truly memorable & I would highly recommend staying here to anyone.
It is not that close to the main temple at Borobudur, more like 30mins away however the views you get here and ambience far outweigh any of the other accomodations we drove past getting to the temple. Food is AMAZING, eat as much as you can!
title: UTTERLY RELAXING & SCENIC!

text: It was sheer pleasure to linger five nights at this delightful little hotel set amid terraced rice fields with splendid mountain views out front and back. Presumably there aren't too many places in rural Indonesia that venture to offer up a menu of both French and local dishes. Unlike a previous reviewer we saw no flies in the restaurant and enjoyed ample breakfasts that included warm croissants, toast and a large platter of fresh fruit. Christophe & Yanti, the proprietors, arranged daily programs to match our interests and provided safe and courteous drivers to escort us to our destinations.  Overall the service was close to flawless and at times unexpected. In the heat of the day, as thirst set in, a smiling waiter would arrive at our door bearing chilled glasses of fresh guava juice. Our room was spotless and the pool conveniently close and refreshing. Although Borobudur is a half hour drive away we found the atmosphere here far preferable to that of other hotels located closer to the monument. We've stayed at numerous five-star establishments around the world but few have left us with warmer memories than this.
title: A Sheer Pleasure

text:
The place consists of 5 rooms run by the French-Indonesian couple Christopher and Yanti. Check their wedding photo at the wall behind reception desk ;-) 

The location is rural and quiet, about one hour drive away from Yogyakarta and a good half hour drive from the famous Borobudur temple. The next town is Magelang which does not offer anything particularly interesting for tourists. 
The scenery of Villa Sumbing is nice and relaxing. It is great to use the pool in the morning which you often have to yourself. The rooms itself are ok, but far from the advertised luxury. The pricing is on the same level as the Phoenix hotel, a 5-star hotel in Yogyakarta in which we had stayed before coming to Villa Sumbing. However, Villa Sumbing lacks far behind in terms of quality. 

Particularly disappointing was the breakfast. On our first day, they served omelett, on the second day nasi goreng, and on the third day omelett again. All with white toast, some fruit, and a watery canned drink that was supposed to be orange juice. Here I could see much potential for improvement. Where is the french baguette that is offered in the restaurant? And serving a real good freshly made juice would also be a nice treat and should not be difficult in the tropics and since they are on the restaurant's menu anyway.
The restaurant calls itself a French restaurant, but advertises American beef as its main specialty. The food was quite ok, particularly in view of the limited alternatives in the nearer area (there are no other restaurants in walking distance and we couldn't find anything appealing in the town of Magelang). 

The biggest problem we had was the many flies at the restaurant. Although it is clear that these come with the rural location and cannot be avoided completely, nothing was done against them at all, even though the restaurant team was well aware of the nuisance. 
Extras offered were very highly priced. For a car with driver, they quoted 600,000 IDR excl. petrol, while we found a local driver for just 250,000 IDR.

Overall, I think the place has potential, but it could be better managed and particularly the breakfast needs improvement to justify the relatively high price tag.
title: It has potential, but...

text:
A 2-hour drive from Yogyakarta, this new hotel offers five rooms of varying size catering to both couples and families. All rooms face the pool and have beautiful views of the neighboring volcanoes (including Merapi) from their porches - though during rainy season, the volcanoes are often obscured by clouds. 
The spacious and spotless rooms feature mosquito nets, a water cooler and a tea & coffee set. Wifi is free and works well in the rooms.
The bathrooms are brand new, clean and tastefully designed.
The friendly and helpful Bahasa and French-speaking owners really look after their guests, offering sightseeing tips, tailored activities and the occasional freshly squeezed juice or banana fritters on the house.
The restaurant, though billed as a French one, in reality serves average international fare ranging from steaks to nasi goreng, though the breakfast omelettes and fresh juices are good. A good option is to ask for a driver to take you to nearby Magelang, where you can try authentic local fare, such as tahu kupat.
Villa Sumbing is conveniently located for visiting Borobudur and for walking in Java's unspoiled nature and rice fields, but remains somewhat far from Prambanan. It's easier to visit Prambanan (which is near Yogyakarta airport) directly from Yogyakarta.
Overall a very pleasant experience and good value for money.
title: Beautiful, relaxing setting away from the city

text:
bu rubi villanya makin indah sja,,,,,,by rendy
salam bwt om cristhoper....
title: excellent

text: A tranquil location far from the mad chaos of city life, offering stunning views of Mt Merapi and rural life in Java.  We stayed for 3 nights over the new year weekend and enjoyed very minute. As in previous reviews we found the hospitality of Yanti, Christophe and their staff to be perfect, never intrusive but always there if needed. Even with the language barrier we still managed to arrange trips, transport and local walks using pigeon French/English and badly drawn maps!  QAfter a long hot New Years day sightseeing at Borobudur (a must see in my opinion) it was heaven to return to the cool calm of the Villa.  Food in the French Bistro was good esp the meats.....my tip would be to ask for rice or potatoes instead of the daily french fries! Overall a special place to have stayed.
title: A little oasis...

text: A gem of a place.  We were 2 couples travelling together without children in early Dec. and stayed here for 4 nights.  After the journey from Yogyakarta through busy streets and bustling towns, the hotel appeared as an oasis of calm nestled amidst bottle green rice paddies with views of the hills and volcano in the distance.  The comfortable and super clean villas are done up in local style.  We had the "VIP" villa which comes wth a dining area where we enjoyed breakfast with our friends each morning.  Yanti and Christophe are charming and made every effort to make our stay comfortable and memorable, arranging airport transport, excursions to Borobudur, Prembanan temples, and Gunung Merapi (volcano), as well as massages at the hotel.  The always smiling staff is eager to please. The restaurant menu is extensive.  We had a thoroughly enjoyable stay and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again or recommend this place to friends.
title: A Gem

text:
Nothing is too much for Christophe and Yanti who own this lovely little hotel. They picked us up from our hotel in Yogyakarta and then 5 days later delivered us safely at the airport for our crack of dawn flight home. Christophe was able to organise drivers for day trips out, ranging from visits to Borobudur to walks in the local mountainous padi fields. The rooms are well presented and clean, all facing the swimming pool. On the one morning when the sunrise was particularly beautiful, Christophe got up extra early to wake us up, we were rewarded with stunning views of the volcanoes and a few cattle walking across the rice padis which made for great photos!
After a long day sightseeing we were always welcomed with a fresh fruit juice, at meals in their restaurant we were always given complimentary 'extra' bites to eat. Little things like this made us feel very welcome.
Breakfasts were always good and we were never limited to anything, as a family of 5 we merrily ate our way through at least 15 deliciously fresh local eggs and dozens of slices of toast every day. When we left, we were awarded with a huge bunch of bananas that were growing at the back of the hotel and a packet of sweets for each of the children. Hugs all round and a list of contacts from Christophe for places to visit on another holiday.
The children loved the freedom and intimacy of the hotel, the restaurant served great homecooked food and we always felt happy to be returning after a hard day's sightseeing.
Overall, excellent value for money and the friendliness of the owners made the stay all the more special.
We were not bothered by mosquitoes, Christophe gave us several mozzie plugs during our stay and we did not feel too hot. However the Muezzines calling from the many mosques was extremely loud on the first night, a pair of earplugs from Christophe soon sorted this out and we slept pretty peacefully thereafter, needless to say that the children never once stirred!
If you are looking for a warm and welcoming place to stay within easy reach of the main sights then Villa Sumbing is a great choice.
title: Get away from it all...

text:
We stayed for 4 nights with a 4 year old child and have highly enjoyed our stay at this wonderful place. The service is outstanding and staff go out of their way to make sure that your stay will be a memorable one. Both owner and staff have great eye for detail and we were always welcomed back from our day trips with a serve of springrolls or fried banana - complementary. The menu is a predominantly western/international menu with some indonesian dishes. The scenery is beautiful, the owners will suggest many activities / trips and have even organised a rental car for us (self drive). Optionally, they can organise a personal driver for you as well, if desired. If you prefer a stay in a tranquil setting then don't hesitate and treat yourself to Villa Sumbing Indah.

Dennis, Sara & Elise
title: Magnifique

text:
We stayed 3 nights at Villa Sumbing Inda. The hotel and the restaurant provide all comfort you can look for but what makes the experience is the warm welcome you will receive at the Villa and in the villages surrounding.
Christophe and Yanti are amazing hosts, always helpful, giving you right advice and always ready to bring you around. The villa is only 30 min from Borobudur and the beautiful thing is that it is located near Sumbing volcano, in the middle of rice fields and indonesian villages. We did some hikes around the villa and had one of our greatest experiences ever, being welcomed everywhere, invited to share tea, take pictures, etc.
I am already looking forward to come back !!
title: Wonderful hosts in a great place !!

photos.caption: Hiking in the neighboring rice fields

text: Great value for a hotel near Borobudur.  The hosts, Yanti and Christophe are helpful and will bend over backwards for you.  We stayed in the superior room, which was great, but all the rooms looked nice and they are all situated next to the pool overlooking the rice fields.  Borobudur is 45 minutes away, so it is not right there but fairly close.  The rooms do NOT have air con which means either closed windows or heavy mosquito net, so makes for a hot night.  The rooms are very clean, we had a cockroach in the really nice bathroom but that's because the hotel is in the middle of the jungle with open air architecture.  There is nothing to walk to in terms of restaurants, but the food here is excellent.  If you are visiting Borobudur, this is a great place to stay for a couple nights.
title: Beautiful resort, wonderful hosts

text: We stayed for 2 nights at this wonderfully picturesque and hospitable place. We were picked up from the Yogyakarta airport by Pak Sindul, the wonderful driver who drove us around for the next 3 days. Though knowing little English, he made it up by his helpful behaviour.The hotel is in a small village surrounded by rice fields with Mt. Merapi visible in a distance. Though it is an 1 hour drive from the airport or from Borobudur, it makes it up by its tranquil and charming setting. The room was well decorated and spacious but lacking a fan or AC. The natural breeze kept it cool at the time of our visit but may not be sufficient for hot summer months.Food was delicious and we relished it. Staff were extremely helpful and even made us tea at 5 am when we requested them. There are only 7 rooms and the rest of the space was given to nature. Breakfast was sumptuous with good Indonesian and Western cuisine. Rooms were cleaned daily and towels replaced. They arranged for our sightseeing trips to Borobudur, Prembanan and Mt. Merapi and even dropped us at our hotel in Yogyakarta.
title: Great place to stay again and again

text:
Christophe & Yanti (& their staffs too) are very warm to us (to every guests too). 
We stayed for 1 night, it was really not enough. We just leisure n relax 1 whole day in the lovely villa without going any place. We were fully enjoy our stay.
Christophe picked us up from Manohara personally, when we reached the villa, Yanti came out to welcome us just like a friends~We are no good in English, & we communicate in Bahasa Malay (or Indonesia Language).
& would like to feel thanks to guide us to "jalan-jalan" around the village, my camera memory card was full during the short walk~It was a very fun experience to look around Tonoboyo. 
Their food is very delicious, healthy & valuable. 
It was rainy night during dinner time, we were looking for sthg to cover so that we could go to the restaurant, then we found that the umbrella was ready at the balcony, what a warm service!
On the way back to Jogja city, we had a delicious "Getuk" from them, really heart touching & thanks when receive it. This is really the most memorable place for my Jogja trip.
If you plan your Jogja trip, please do reserve 1 day/night for Villa Sumbing Indah. This will be your unforgotten memory during your Jogya trip as me.
title: I wish to go back again.

photos.caption: Christophe specially let me go in their suite to take photo of Gunung Sumbing
Misty padi field in the early morning.

text:
Take ear plugs if you prefer not to wake up at 4am with the call to prayer - that goes for EVERYWHERE we stayed on our trip so it is not special to Villa Sumbing Indah. What is special at this lovely little place is the wonderfully friendly and happy atmosphere. The staff are super - the owners delightful and they try really hard to make it a good experience.

It is simple, clean and very pretty - everything you need and a peaceful escape from everything. We all loved being there and our three kids are very keen to go back.
title: Very warm and welcoming hosts.... great setting

text:
We had a lovely stay for 2 nights at Villa Sumbing Indah. This place is amazing with excellent food, the facilities was in superior condition, and Christophe and Yanti's hospitality and top service made our stay a very memorable one. Travelling with two kids (age 9 and 11), it was enjoyable for them also with the very nice pool and friendly staff. Our family villa had a separate bed room so the kids did not have to sleep in the same room as us adults. The houses are made of very good quality and dedicated attention to details. When you see you will believe...The location is good, overlooking the Mount Merapi and another volcanic mountain. Only 20 minutes to drive Borobudur temple, which is a world heritage site and a must-see fantastic 8th century remarkable creation.

Prior to arrival, we had been on another beatiful place in Indonesia, on a private island between Java and Borneo (check out Kura Kura Resort). So the driver from Villa Sumbing Indah came and picked us up at the hotel we stayed before in the city of Semarang. Two hour drive to Magelang (the area where Villa Sumbing Indah is located) went fine, beatiful scenery with jungle and volcano mountains. We also used their driver to take us to Borobudur and other sites in the area, and also the drove us back to Yogyakarta for the airport drop-off. Everything was done to our full satisfaction.
I will reccomend Villa Sumbing Indah to anyone who is looking for a quite and peaceful hideaway with access to great sites nearby (Borobudur) and the best french kitchen we have tried while living 2.5 years in Indonesia. I must highlight the friendliness and hospitality of the owners and staff, it is truly remarkable.

Regards
Norwegian Expat family
title: Excellent, relaxing and fantastic food

text:
We spent two nights at Villa Sumbing in early September 2011 and found it to be a special place.
You could use it as a base to visit Jogya, Borobudur, Prambanam and other temples but we used it as a base to go to the Dieng Plateau for one day and the other day we spent a lovely morning by the gorgeous pool before moving on to Bandungan.
The rooms are very comfortable, with free drinking water, welcome drinks, mosquitto coils and net and a particularly nice bathroom with a lovely shower and free toilettries.  
The setting is stunning - one side we had a glowing volcano and the other stunning green rice fields. The pool runs in front of all the rooms and is so lovely.  Such a peaceful place to relax.
The owners are a lovely couple - Indonesian wife and French husband.  They were very welcoming and helpful.  We arranged our tour to the Dieng Plateau and also transfers from and to the hotel via email beforehand - all of which ran very smoothly once we arrived.  You only need a driver to take you to the Dieng Plateau - if you have a guidebook, you will be able to tell the driver where you want to go and I doubt an additional guide would add much.  Our drive to the Dieng Plateau was via the slightly slower scenic route which was stunning and unrivalled throughout the rest of our trip.
Due to the French influence, the restaurant at the hotel is great (although relatively expensive - still cheap in comparison to European prices though!).  The French and Italian dishes are delicious and a pleasant contrast to the Indonesian food.  Breakfast is great as well - fruit platter, eggs, freshly baked croissants.
The only 'drawbacks' (if they can even be called that) are first, that the staff do not speak much English - but still enough to arrange everything.  If you do not speak Indonesian but can speak French, you should definitely communicate in French rather than English!  That said, my husband and I speak neither Indonesian nor French and we had no problems - but probably helped by the fact we had arranged things via email before arriving.  Secondly, the first night we stayed at the hotel, we slept with the windows open as there is no air conditioning (but shutters closed).  The calls to morning prayer from the nearby mosques at around 5am woke us up and lasted for about an hour - but the second night, with the windows closed, we slept much better - we weren't too hot as the rooms are lovely and cool and we were only mildly disturbed by the mosques.  But then that is part of the Java experience - every hotel will be near a mosque!
We would definitely refer this hotel to friends and family and if we return to Java, would very  happily stay here again.
title: Lovely hotel set in a beautiful location

text: This could be the best guest house in Java-all things considered. Christophe and Yani are terrific hosts and absolutely care about your every wish. From the wonderfully maintained 25 meter pool to the perfectly located spotless rooms and superb restaurant, you couldn't ask for more and at a price that is unbelievable. Set in the hills over looking Magelang, Christophe has created a  property that with his superbly capable wife is what all future small inn keepers dream of owning and in the tropics yet!  From the marvelous breakfasts to the French, European, and Indonesian noon and evening meals, the kitchen shines. Cool off in the most inviting pool this side of that high end resort in Borobudur (you know the one) and you have the receipt for an unforgetable visit.  If you're in Indonesia or thinking of going, don't think about it-book it now!
title: Wonderful Visit-A Fabulous Gem of a Property!

text:
Nous avions réservé la suite pour 2 nuits. Nous avons eu la désagréable surprise que la suite ait été attribuée (après notre réservation) à des habitués. Ainsi, nous avons été déplacé dans une maisonnette tout au fond du jardin. Elle était jolie de prime abord mais nous avons vite déchanté : la propreté laissait à désirer, le lit était particulièrement inconfortable avec des craquements lugubres à chaque mouvement, pas d'eau chaude dans la douche.... sans compter que nous avons dû cohabiter avec les grenouilles, les cafards et une multitude de moustiques.
Nous avons écourté notre séjour en partant après seulement une nuit. Comme nous avions réservé deux nuits, et même si nous n'avions pas la suite choisie (qui elle, semble bien plus moderne), notre annulation nous a tout de même coûté 500 000 Rp !

Ce qui est certain c'est qu'il faut fuir la "maison de vacances". Les chambres standards avaient l'air bien mieux pour beaucoup moins cher !

La pratique d'attribuer notre réservation à un autre client est très incorrecte. Nous avons été trop gentil en nous montrant conciliant lorsque nous avons été mis devant le fait accompli en arrivant et nous n'aurions pas dû. Quant à nous présenter ce changement comme un upgrade, ce n'est pas très honnête...
title: Mauvais plan...

text:
Une petite parenthèse enchantée à la campagne au calme! Les propriétaires Christophe et Yanti ont été au petit soin avec moi. J'ai pu faire une belle balade dans les rizières, un massage au top, etc...
Les chambres sont spacieuses et propres. 
Le restaurant propose des plats variés et de qualité. Le petit petit-déjeuner est très copieux et tout est fait maison (pain et confitures y compris!)
title: Un havre de paix et un service au top!

text: Excellent accueil. Cadre très agréable au calme. Chambre très confortable. Endroit où il est bon de séjourner. Produits de qualité pour la Restauration. De bons plats divers et variés avec une touche « à la française ». De délicates attentions de la part des propriétaires. Une bonne organisation pour les randonnées et autres. Bravo !
